Results for

ACCESS_SHARED_IDENTITY

Value: 259743961
Enabled for all apps.

Grants access to the launching app's identity if the app opted-in to sharing its identity by launching this activity with an instance of ActivityOptions on which ActivityOptions.setShareIdentityEnabled(boolean) was invoked with a value of true, or if the launched activity's uid is the same as the launching app's. When this change is enabled and one of these requirements is met, the activity can access the launching app's uid and package name with Activity.getLaunchedFromUid() and Activity.getLaunchedFromPackage(), respectively.

ACCOUNT_ACCESS_CHECK_CHANGE_ID

Value: 201794303
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

Enables checking for account access for the calling uid on all sync-related APIs.

ADD_CONTENT_OBSERVER_FLAGS

Value: 150939131
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Starting in Build.VERSION_CODES.R, there is a new public API overload onChange(boolean, Uri, int) that delivers a int flags argument.

Some apps may be relying on a previous hidden API that delivered a int userId argument, and this change is used to control delivery of the new int flags argument in its place.

ADMIN_APP_PASSWORD_COMPLEXITY

Value: 123562444
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

For admin apps targeting R+, throw when the app sets password requirement that is not taken into account at given quality. For example when quality is set to DevicePolicyManager.PASSWORD_QUALITY_UNSPECIFIED, it doesn't make sense to require certain password length. If the intent is to require a password of certain length having at least NUMERIC quality, the admin should first call DevicePolicyManager.setPasswordQuality(ComponentName, int) and only then call DevicePolicyManager.setPasswordMinimumLength(ComponentName, int).

Conversely when an admin app targeting R+ lowers password quality, those requirements that stop making sense are reset to default values.

ALLOW_COPY_SOLID_COLOR_VIEW

Value: 205907456
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

Application is allowed to receive the SplashScreen.OnExitAnimationListener.onSplashScreenExit(SplashScreenView) callback, even when the splash screen only shows a solid color.

ALLOW_SECURE_ACTIVITY_DISPLAY_ON_REMOTE_DEVICE

Value: 201712607
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

If required, allow the secure activity to display on remote device since Build.VERSION_CODES.TIRAMISU.

ALLOW_TEST_API_ACCESS

Value: 166236554
Disabled for all apps.

Allow apps accessing @TestApi APIs.

This will always be disabled by default and should only be used by platform test code.

ALLOW_WEARABLE_SENSING_SERVICE_FILE_READ

Value: 330701114
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

If the WearableSensingService implementation belongs to the same APK as the caller, calling ERROR(/#provideDataStream(ParcelFileDescriptor, Executor, Consumer)) will allow WearableSensingService to read from the caller's file directory via ERROR(/Context#openFileInput(String)). The read will be proxied via the caller's process and executed by the executor provided to this method.

ALWAYS_SANDBOX_DISPLAY_APIS

Value: 185004937
Disabled for all apps.

This change id forces the packages it is applied to always have Display API sandboxing applied, regardless of windowing mode. The Display APIs will always provide the app bounds.

ALWAYS_USE_CONTEXT_USER

Value: 183155436
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

For apps targeting Build.VERSION_CODES.TIRAMISU and above, any UserManager API marked as ERROR(@UserHandleAware/android.annotation.UserHandleAware @UserHandleAware) will use the context user (rather than the calling user). For apps targeting an SDK version below this, the behaviour depends on the particular method and when it was first introduced:

  • if the @UserHandleAware specifies a ERROR(/android.annotation.UserHandleAware#enabledSinceTargetSdkVersion) of Build.VERSION_CODES.TIRAMISU the calling user is used.
  • if the @UserHandleAware doesn't specify a ERROR(/android.annotation.UserHandleAware#enabledSinceTargetSdkVersion), the context user is used.
  • there should currently be no other values used by UserManager for ERROR(/android.annotation.UserHandleAware#enabledSinceTargetSdkVersion), since all old implicitly user-dependant APIs were updated in that version and anything introduced more recently should already be @UserHandleAware.
Note that when an API marked with ERROR(/android.annotation.UserHandleAware#enabledSinceTargetSdkVersion) is run on a device whose OS predates that version, the calling user will be used, since on such a device, the API is not @UserHandleAware yet.

ANR_PRE_UDC_APIS_ON_SLOW_RESPONSES

Value: 258236856
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Whether to trigger an ANR when apps are slow to respond on pre-UDC APIs and functionality.

APN_READING_PERMISSION_CHANGE_ID

Value: 124107808
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Compat framework change ID for the APN db read permission change. In API level 30 and beyond, accessing the APN database will require the Manifest.permission.WRITE_APN_SETTINGS permission. This change ID tracks apps that are affected because they don't hold this permission.

APP_DATA_DIRECTORY_ISOLATION

Value: 143937733
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Apps have no access to the private data directories of any other app, even if the other app has made them world-readable.

ASM_RESTRICTIONS

Value: 230590090
Disabled for all apps.

Feature flag for go/activity-security rules

AUTHORITY_ACCESS_CHECK_CHANGE_ID

Value: 207133734
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Enables checking for authority access for the calling uid on all sync-related APIs.

AUTOFILL_NON_TEXT_REQUIRES_ON_RECEIVE_CONTENT_LISTENER

Value: 163400105
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 32.

On Android S and above, the platform can provide non-text suggestions (e.g. images) via the augmented autofill framework (see autofill services). In order for an app to be able to handle these suggestions, it must normally implement the OnReceiveContentListener API. To make the adoption of this smoother for apps that have previously implemented the InputConnection.commitContent(InputContentInfo, int, Bundle) API, we reuse that API as a fallback if OnReceiveContentListener is not yet implemented by the app. This fallback is only enabled on Android S. This change ID disables the fallback, such that apps targeting Android T and above must implement the OnReceiveContentListener API in order to accept non-text suggestions.

BACKGROUND_RATIONALE_CHANGE_ID

Value: 147316723
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

This change makes it so that apps are told to show rationale for asking for background location access every time they request.

BLOCK_GPS_STATUS_USAGE

Value: 144027538
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

For apps targeting Android S and above, all GpsStatus API usage must be replaced with GnssStatus APIs.

BLOCK_IMMUTABLE_PENDING_INTENTS

Value: 171317480
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

For apps targeting Android S and above, immutable PendingIntents passed into location APIs will generate an IllegalArgumentException.

BLOCK_INCOMPLETE_LOCATIONS

Value: 148964793
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 17.

For apps targeting Android K and above, incomplete locations may not be passed to setTestProviderLocation(String, Location).

BLOCK_MUTABLE_IMPLICIT_PENDING_INTENT

Value: 236704164
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

BLOCK_NULL_ACTION_INTENTS

Value: 293560872
Disabled for all apps.

An intent with action set as null used to always pass the action test during intent filter matching. This causes a lot of confusion and unexpected intent matches. Null action intents should be blocked when the intent sender application targets V or higher.

BLOCK_PENDING_INTENT_SYSTEM_API_USAGE

Value: 169887240
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

For apps targeting Android S and above, LocationRequest system APIs may not be used with PendingIntent location requests.

BLOCK_UNTARGETED_PENDING_INTENTS

Value: 148963590
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 17.

For apps targeting Android K and above, supplied PendingIntents must be targeted to a specific package.

BLOCK_UNTRUSTED_TOUCHES

Value: 158002302
Enabled for all apps.

Prevent touches from being consumed by apps if these touches passed through a non-trusted window from a different UID and are considered unsafe.

BORINGLAYOUT_FALLBACK_LINESPACING

Value: 210923482
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

This change ID enables the fallback text line spacing (line height) for BoringLayout.

CALLBACK_ON_CLEAR_CHANGE

Value: 119147584
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

There will now be a callback to OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener.onSharedPreferenceChanged with a null key on Editor.clear.

CALLBACK_ON_MORE_ERROR_CODE_CHANGE

Value: 130595455
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

To expand the error codes for updateAvailableNetworks(List, Executor, Consumer) and setPreferredOpportunisticDataSubscription(int, boolean, Executor, Consumer).

CALL_ACTIVITY_RESULT_BEFORE_RESUME

Value: 78294732
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 32.

Correct the lifecycle of activity result after Build.VERSION_CODES.S to guarantee that an activity gets activity result just before resume.

CALL_BACK_ON_CHANGED_LISTENER_WITH_SWITCHED_OP_CHANGE

Value: 148180766
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

This is a subtle behavior change to startWatchingMode(String, String, OnOpChangedListener). Before this change the system called back for the switched op. After the change the system will call back for the actually requested op or all switched ops if no op is specified.

CALL_REDIRECTION_AUDIO_MODES

Value: 189472651
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

This change id controls use of audio modes for call audio redirection.

CAMERA_MICROPHONE_CAPABILITY_CHANGE_ID

Value: 136219221
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

In targetSdkVersion R and above, foreground service has camera and microphone while-in-use capability only when the R.attr.foregroundServiceType is configured as ServiceInfo.FOREGROUND_SERVICE_TYPE_CAMERA and ServiceInfo.FOREGROUND_SERVICE_TYPE_MICROPHONE respectively in the manifest file. In targetSdkVersion below R, foreground service automatically have camera and microphone capabilities.

CAMERA_MIC_INDICATORS_NOT_PRESENT

Value: 162547999
Disabled for all apps.

A ChangeId indicating that this device supports camera and mic indicators. Will be "false" if present, because the CompatChanges#isChangeEnabled method returns true if the change id is not present.

CANNOT_INSTALL_WITH_BAD_PERMISSION_GROUPS

Value: 146211400
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 32.

Refuse to install package if groups of permissions are bad - Permission groups should only be shared between apps sharing a certificate - If a permission belongs to a group that group should be defined

CANONICALIZE_PARENT_OF_ROOT_DIR

Value: 312399441
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Canonicalize the parent directory of the root directory when app targets SDK level 35 (Android 15) or higher. "/.." can be canonicalized into "/" according to POSIX.

CHANGE_ALWAYS_DISABLED

Value: 210856463
Disabled for all apps.

Change ID which is always disabled, for testing purposes.

CHANGE_ALWAYS_ENABLED

Value: 209888056
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 1.

Change ID which is always enabled, for testing purposes.

CHANGE_BACKGROUND_CUSTOM_TOAST_BLOCK

Value: 128611929
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Apps that post custom toasts in the background will have those blocked. Apps can still post toasts created with ERROR(/Toast#makeText(Context, CharSequence, int)) and its variants while in the background.

CHANGE_ID_AUTH_STATE_DENIED

Value: 181350407
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

For clients targeting S and above, a SecurityException is thrown when they are in the denied authorization state and attempt to send a message to a nanoapp.

CHANGE_ID_SAMPLING_RATE_SENSORS_PERMISSION

Value: 136069189
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

For apps targeting S and above, a SecurityException is thrown when they do not have HIGH_SAMPLING_RATE_SENSORS permission, run in debug mode, and request sampling rates that are faster than 200 Hz.

CHANGE_RESTRICT_SAW_INTENT

Value: 135920175
Used for logging only.

Intents with action android.settings.MANAGE_APP_OVERLAY_PERMISSION and data URI scheme package don't go to the app-specific screen for managing the permission anymore. Instead, they redirect to this screen for managing all the apps that have requested such permission.

CHANGE_TEXT_TOASTS_IN_THE_SYSTEM

Value: 147798919
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Text toasts will be rendered by SystemUI instead of in-app, so apps can't circumvent background custom toast restrictions.

CHANGE_TO_STRING_REDACTED

Value: 265103382
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Starting from Build.VERSION_CODES.UPSIDE_DOWN_CAKE, the return value of toString() has changed to improve privacy.

CHECK_MIN_WIDTH_HEIGHT_FOR_MULTI_WINDOW

Value: 197654537
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

Compares activity window layout min width/height with require space for multi window to determine if it can be put into multi window mode.

CHECK_PARAMS_IN_IS_SESSION_CONFIGURATION_SUPPORTED

Value: 320741775
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Starting ERROR(/Build.VERSION_CODES#VANILLA_ICE_CREAM), ERROR(/#isSessionConfigurationSupported) also checks for compatibility of session parameters when supported by the HAL. This ChangeId guards enabling that functionality for apps that target ERROR(/Build.VERSION_CODES#VANILLA_ICE_CREAM) and above.

CLEAR_SHOW_FORCED_FLAG_WHEN_LEAVING

Value: 214016041
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

Clear SHOW_FORCED flag when the next IME focused application changed.

Note that when this flag enabled in server side, SHOW_FORCED will no longer affect the next focused application to keep showing IME, in case of unexpected IME visible when the next focused app isn't be the IME requester.

Value: 296478951

If enabled the creator will not allow BAL on its behalf by default.

DEFAULT_RESCIND_BAL_PRIVILEGES_FROM_PENDING_INTENT_SENDER

Value: 244637991
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

DEFAULT_SCOPED_STORAGE

Value: 149924527
Enabled for all apps.

Scoped Storage is on by default. However, it is not strictly enforced and there are multiple ways to opt out of scoped storage:

  • Target Sdk < Q
  • Target Sdk = Q and has `requestLegacyExternalStorage` set in AndroidManifest.xml
  • Target Sdk > Q: Upgrading from an app that was opted out of scoped storage and has `preserveLegacyExternalStorage` set in AndroidManifest.xml
This flag is enabled for all apps by default as Scoped Storage is enabled by default. Developers can disable this flag to opt out of Scoped Storage and have legacy storage workflow. Note: FORCE_ENABLE_SCOPED_STORAGE should also be disabled for apps to opt out of scoped storage. Note: This flag is also used in com.android.providers.media.LocalCallingIdentity. Any modifications to this flag should be reflected there as well. See https://developer.android.com/training/data-storage#scoped-storage for more information.

DEFER_BOOT_COMPLETED_BROADCAST_CHANGE_ID

Value: 203704822
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

Defer LOCKED_BOOT_COMPLETED and BOOT_COMPLETED broadcasts until the first time any process in the UID is started.

DELIVER_HISTORICAL_LOCATIONS

Value: 73144566
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

For apps targeting Android S and above, location clients may receive historical locations (from before the present time) under some circumstances.

DEPRECATE_UI_FONT

Value: 279646685
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

A change ID for deprecating UI fonts. From API Build.VERSION_CODES.VANILLA_ICE_CREAM, the default value will be true by default if the app has a target SDK of API Build.VERSION_CODES.VANILLA_ICE_CREAM or later.

DETACH_THROWS_ISE_ONLY

Value: 236825255
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Flag to gate correct exception thrown by #detachImage.

#detachImage is documented as throwing IllegalStateException in the event of an error; a native helper method to this threw RuntimeException if the surface was abandoned while detaching the Image.

This previously undocumented exception behavior continues through Android T.

After Android T, the native helper method only throws IllegalStateExceptions in accordance with the documentation.

#detachImage will now throw only ISEs if it runs into errors while detaching the image. Behavior on apps targeting API levels <= T remains unchanged.

DETECT_EXPLICIT_GC

Value: 3400644
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Detect explicit calls to Runtime.gc().

DISABLE_DRAW_WAKE_LOCK

Value: 349153669
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

This change disables the DRAW_WAKE_LOCK, an internal wakelock acquired per-frame duration display DOZE. It was added to allow animation during AOD. This wakelock consumes battery severely if the animation is too heavy, so, it will be removed.

DISABLE_DRAW_WAKE_LOCK_WALLPAPER

Value: 361433696
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

This change disables the DRAW_WAKE_LOCK, an internal wakelock acquired per-frame duration display DOZE. It was added to allow animation during AOD. This wakelock consumes battery severely if the animation is too heavy, so, it will be removed.

DISALLOW_DEADLINES_FOR_PREFETCH_JOBS

Value: 194532703
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

Disallow setting a deadline (via JobInfo.Builder.setOverrideDeadline(long)) for prefetch jobs (JobInfo.Builder.setPrefetch(boolean). Prefetch jobs are meant to run close to the next app launch, so there's no good reason to allow them to have deadlines. We don't drop or cancel any previously scheduled prefetch jobs with a deadline. There's no way for an app to keep a perpetually scheduled prefetch job with a deadline. Prefetch jobs with a deadline will run and apps under this restriction won't be able to schedule new prefetch jobs with a deadline. If a job is rescheduled (by providing true via JobService.jobFinished(JobParameters, boolean) or JobService.onStopJob(JobParameters)'s return value),the deadline is dropped. Periodic jobs require all constraints to be met, so there's no issue with their deadlines.

DISALLOW_DUPLICATE_FIELD_IN_SKELETON

Value: 170233598
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

getBestDateTimePattern(Locale, String) does not allow non-consecutive repeated symbol in the skeleton. For example, please use a skeleton of "jmm" or "hmma" instead of "ahmma" or "jmma", because the field 'j' could mean using 12-hour in some locales and, in this case, is duplicated as the 'a' field.

DISALLOW_INPUT_METHOD_INTERFACE_OVERRIDE

Value: 148086656
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Disallow IMEs to override onCreateInputMethodSessionInterface() method.

If IMEs targeting on Android U and beyond override the onCreateInputMethodSessionInterface(), an LinkageError would be thrown.

DISALLOW_INVALID_GROUP_REFERENCE

Value: 247079863
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Since Android 14, Matcher becomes stricter for the replacement syntax and group references used by its methods, e.g. appendReplacement(StringBuffer, String). This flag is enabled for apps targeting Android 14+.

DISPLAY_INFO_NR_ADVANCED_SUPPORTED

Value: 181658987
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

Support backward compatibility for TelephonyDisplayInfo.

DISPLAY_MODE_RETURNS_PHYSICAL_REFRESH_RATE

Value: 170503758
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

Applications use Display.getRefreshRate() and Display.Mode.getRefreshRate() to know what is the display refresh rate. Starting with Android S, the platform might throttle down applications frame rate to a divisor of the refresh rate if it is more preferable (for example if the application called to Surface.setFrameRate(float, int)). Applications will experience Choreographer.postFrameCallback(FrameCallback) callbacks and backpressure at the throttled frame rate. Display.getRefreshRate() will always return the application frame rate and not the physical display refresh rate to allow applications to do frame pacing correctly. Display.Mode.getRefreshRate() will return the application frame rate if compiled to a previous release and starting with Android S it will return the physical display refresh rate.

DOWNSCALED

Value: 168419799
Disabled for all apps.

DOWNSCALED is the gatekeeper of all per-app buffer downscaling changes. Enabling this change will allow the following scaling factors: DOWNSCALE_90 DOWNSCALE_85 DOWNSCALE_80 DOWNSCALE_75 DOWNSCALE_70 DOWNSCALE_65 DOWNSCALE_60 DOWNSCALE_55 DOWNSCALE_50 DOWNSCALE_45 DOWNSCALE_40 DOWNSCALE_35 DOWNSCALE_30 If DOWNSCALED is enabled for an app package, then the app will be forcibly resized to the highest enabled scaling factor e.g. 80% if both 80% and 70% were enabled. When both DOWNSCALED_INVERSE and DOWNSCALED are enabled, then DOWNSCALED_INVERSE takes precedence.

DOWNSCALED_INVERSE

Value: 273564678
Disabled for all apps.

DOWNSCALED_INVERSE is the gatekeeper of all per-app buffer inverse downscale changes. Enabling this change will allow the following scaling factors: DOWNSCALE_90 DOWNSCALE_85 DOWNSCALE_80 DOWNSCALE_75 DOWNSCALE_70 DOWNSCALE_65 DOWNSCALE_60 DOWNSCALE_55 DOWNSCALE_50 DOWNSCALE_45 DOWNSCALE_40 DOWNSCALE_35 DOWNSCALE_30 If DOWNSCALED_INVERSE is enabled for an app package, then the app will be forcibly resized to the lowest enabled scaling factor e.g. 1/0.8 if both 1/0.8 and 1/0.7 (* 100%) were enabled. When both DOWNSCALED_INVERSE and DOWNSCALED are enabled, then DOWNSCALED_INVERSE takes precedence.

DOWNSCALE_30

Value: 189970040
Disabled for all apps.

With DOWNSCALED enabled, subsequently enabling change-id DOWNSCALE_30 for a package will force the app to assume it's running on a display with 30% the vertical and horizontal resolution of the real display. With DOWNSCALED_INVERSE enabled will force the app to assume it's running on a display with 333.33% the vertical and horizontal resolution of the real display

DO_NOT_CLONE_IN_ARRAYS_AS_LIST

Value: 202956589
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Since Android 15 Arrays.asList(...).toArray()'s component type is Object, not the underlying array's elements type. So the following code will throw ClassCastException: 

String[] elements = (String[]) Arrays.asList("one", "two").toArray();
You can overcome this by using Collection.toArray(Object[]): 
String[] elements = Arrays.asList("two", "one").toArray(new String[0]);

DO_NOT_DOWNSCALE_TO_1080P_ON_TV

Value: 157629738
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

On Android TV applications that target pre-S are not expecting to receive a Window larger than 1080p, so if needed we are downscaling their Windows to 1080p. However, applications that target S and greater release version are expected to be able to handle any Window size, so we should not downscale their Windows.

Do not show a toast on the virtual display when a secure surface is shown after Build.VERSION_CODES.VANILLA_ICE_CREAM. VDM clients should use ERROR(/VirtualDeviceManager.ActivityListener#onSecureWindowShown) instead to provide a custom notification if desired.

DROP_CLOSE_SYSTEM_DIALOGS

Value: 174664120
Enabled for all apps.

Intent Intent.ACTION_CLOSE_SYSTEM_DIALOGS is too powerful to be unrestricted. We restrict its usage for a few legitimate use-cases only, regardless of targetSdk. For the other use-cases we drop the intent with a log message. Note that this is the lighter version of #LOCK_DOWN_CLOSE_SYSTEM_DIALOGS which is not gated on targetSdk in order to eliminate the abuse vector.

Value: 244358506
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Enable physical camera availability callbacks when the logical camera is unavailable

Previously once a logical camera becomes unavailable, no CameraManager.AvailabilityCallback.onPhysicalCameraAvailable(String, String) or CameraManager.AvailabilityCallback.onPhysicalCameraUnavailable(String, String) will be called until the logical camera becomes available again. The results in the app opening the logical camera not able to receive physical camera availability change.

With this change, the CameraManager.AvailabilityCallback.onPhysicalCameraAvailable(String, String) and CameraManager.AvailabilityCallback.onPhysicalCameraUnavailable(String, String) can still be called while the logical camera is unavailable.

ENFORCE_INTENTS_TO_MATCH_INTENT_FILTERS

Value: 161252188
Disabled for all apps.

Intents sent from apps enabling this feature will stop resolving to components with non matching intent filters, even when explicitly setting a component name, unless the target components are in the same app as the calling app.

When an app registers an exported component in its manifest and adds <intent-filter>s, the component can be started by any intent - even those that do not match the intent filter. This has proven to be something that many developers find counterintuitive. Without checking the intent when the component is started, in some circumstances this can allow 3P apps to trigger internal-only functionality.

ENFORCE_MINIMUM_WINDOW_ON_INEXACT_ALARMS

Value: 185199076
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

For apps targeting Build.VERSION_CODES.S or above, all inexact alarms will require to have a minimum window size, expected to be on the order of a few minutes. Practically, any alarms requiring smaller windows are the same as exact alarms and should use the corresponding APIs provided, like setExact(int, long, PendingIntent), et al. Inexact alarm with shorter windows specified will have their windows elongated by the system.

ENFORCE_NATIVE_SHARED_LIBRARY_DEPENDENCIES

Value: 142191088
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

Apps targeting Android S and above need to declare dependencies to the public native shared libraries that are defined by the device maker using uses-native-library tag in its AndroidManifest.xml. If any of the dependencies cannot be satisfied, i.e. one of the dependency doesn't exist, the package manager rejects to install the app. The dependency can be specified as optional using android:required attribute in the tag, in which case failing to satisfy the dependency doesn't stop the installation.

Once installed, an app is provided with only the native shared libraries that are specified in the app manifest. dlopening a native shared library that doesn't appear in the app manifest will fail even if it actually exists on the device.

FORCE_DISABLE_HEVC_SUPPORT

Value: 174227820
Disabled for all apps.

Force disable an app from supporting the HEVC media capability Apps should declare their supported media capabilities in their manifest but this flag can be used to force an app into not supporting HEVC, hence forcing transcoding while accessing media encoded in HEVC. Setting this flag will override any OS level defaults for apps. It is disabled by default, meaning that the OS defaults would take precedence. Setting this flag and FORCE_ENABLE_HEVC_SUPPORT is an undefined state and will result in the OS ignoring both flags.

KEYSTORE_OPERATION_CREATION_MAY_FAIL

Value: 169897160
Disabled for all apps.

Keystore operation creation may fail Keystore used to work under the assumption that the creation of cryptographic operations always succeeds. However, the KeyMint backend has only a limited number of operation slots. In order to keep up the appearance of "infinite" operation slots, the Keystore daemon would prune least recently used operations if there is no available operation slot. As a result, good operations could be terminated prematurely. This opens AndroidKeystore up to denial-of-service and unintended livelock situations. E.g.: if multiple apps wake up at the same time, e.g., due to power management optimizations, and attempt to perform crypto operations, they start terminating each others operations without making any progress. To break out of livelocks and to discourage DoS attempts we have changed the pruning strategy such that it prefers clients that use few operation slots and only briefly. As a result we can, almost, guarantee that single operations that don't linger inactive for more than 5 seconds will conclude unhampered by the pruning strategy. "Almost", because there are operations related to file system encryption that can prune even these operations, but those are extremely rare. As a side effect of this new pruning strategy operation creation can now fail if the client has a lower pruning power than all of the existing operations. Pruning strategy To find a suitable candidate we compute the malus for the caller and each existing operation. The malus is the inverse of the pruning power (caller) or pruning resistance (existing operation). For the caller to be able to prune an operation it must find an operation with a malus higher than its own. For more detail on the pruning strategy consult the implementation at https://android.googlesource.com/platform/system/security/+/refs/heads/master/keystore2/src/operation.rs For older SDK version, KeyStore2 will poll the Keystore daemon for a free operation slot. So to applications, targeting earlier SDK versions, it will still look like cipher and signature object initialization always succeeds, however, it may take longer to get an operation. All SDK version benefit from fairer operation slot scheduling and a better chance to successfully conclude an operation.

LAZY_INITIALIZE_SUBSCRIPTIONS_CHANGED_HANDLER

Value: 278814050
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

After Build.VERSION_CODES.Q, it is no longer necessary to instantiate a Handler inside of the OnSubscriptionsChangedListener in all cases, so it will only be done for callers that do not supply an Executor.

LINE_HEIGHT_FOR_LOCALE

Value: 303326708
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

LISTEN_CODE_CHANGE

Value: 147600208
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 29.

To check the SDK version for #listenFromListener.

LOCK_DOWN_CLOSE_SYSTEM_DIALOGS

Value: 174664365
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

Intent Intent.ACTION_CLOSE_SYSTEM_DIALOGS is too powerful to be unrestricted. So, apps targeting Build.VERSION_CODES.S or higher will crash if they try to send such intent and don't have permission android.permission.BROADCAST_CLOSE_SYSTEM_DIALOGS. Note that this is the more restrict version of #DROP_CLOSE_SYSTEM_DIALOGS that expects the app to stop sending aforementioned intent once it bumps its targetSdk to Build.VERSION_CODES.S or higher.

LOCK_DOWN_COLLAPSE_STATUS_BAR

Value: 173031413
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

Apps targeting Build.VERSION_CODES.S or higher need Manifest.permission.STATUS_BAR permission to collapse the status bar panels due to security reasons. This was being exploited by malware to prevent the user from accessing critical notifications.

LOG_MBA_INFO

Value: 245692487
Enabled for all apps.

Guards whether or not measurements of MBA to be performed. When this change is enabled, measurements of MBAs are performed. But when it is disabled, only measurements of APEX and modules are done.

LOW_POWER_EXCEPTIONS

Value: 168936375
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

For apps targeting Android S and above, all LocationRequest objects marked as low power will throw exceptions if the caller does not have the LOCATION_HARDWARE permission, instead of silently dropping the low power part of the request.

App calls to ERROR(/NotificationManager#setInterruptionFilter) and ERROR(/NotificationManager#setNotificationPolicy) manage DND through the creation and activation of an implicit ERROR(/AutomaticZenRule).

Used for logging only.

Media controls based on Notification.MediaStyle notifications should include a non-empty title, either in the MediaMetadata or notification title.

MEDIA_CONTROL_SESSION_ACTIONS

Value: 203800354
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

Media controls based on Notification.MediaStyle notifications will have actions based on the media session's PlaybackState, rather than the notification's actions. These actions will be: - Play/Pause (depending on whether the current state is a playing state) - Previous (if declared), or a custom action if the slot is not reserved with SESSION_EXTRAS_KEY_SLOT_RESERVATION_SKIP_TO_PREV - Next (if declared), or a custom action if the slot is not reserved with SESSION_EXTRAS_KEY_SLOT_RESERVATION_SKIP_TO_NEXT - Custom action - Custom action @see androidx.media.utils.MediaConstants#SESSION_EXTRAS_KEY_SLOT_RESERVATION_SKIP_TO_PREV @see androidx.media.utils.MediaConstants#SESSION_EXTRAS_KEY_SLOT_RESERVATION_SKIP_TO_NEXT

MISSING_EXPORTED_FLAG

MULTIPLE_ACTIVE_HOTWORD_DETECTORS

Value: 193232191
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

For apps targeting Build.VERSION_CODES.UPSIDE_DOWN_CAKE and above, implementors of this service can create multiple AlwaysOnHotwordDetector instances in parallel. They will also e ale to create a single SoftwareHotwordDetector in parallel with any other active AlwaysOnHotwordDetector instances.

Requirements when this change is enabled:

  • Any number of AlwaysOnHotwordDetector instances can be created in parallel as long as they are unique to any other active AlwaysOnHotwordDetector.
  • Only a single instance of SoftwareHotwordDetector can be active at a given time. It can be active at the same time as any number of AlwaysOnHotwordDetector instances.
  • To release that reference and any resources associated with that reference, HotwordDetector#destroy() must be called. An attempt to create an HotwordDetector equal to an active HotwordDetector will be rejected until HotwordDetector#destroy() is called on the active instance.

Native heap allocations will now have a non-zero tag in the most significant byte. @see Tagged Pointers

Value: 178038272

NATIVE_MEMTAG_ASYNC

Value: 135772972
Disabled for all apps.

Enable asynchronous (ASYNC) memory tag checking in this process. This flag will only have an effect on hardware supporting the ARM Memory Tagging Extension (MTE).

NATIVE_MEMTAG_SYNC

Value: 177438394
Disabled for all apps.

Enable synchronous (SYNC) memory tag checking in this process. This flag will only have an effect on hardware supporting the ARM Memory Tagging Extension (MTE). If both NATIVE_MEMTAG_ASYNC and this option is selected, this option takes preference and MTE is enabled in SYNC mode.

NETWORK_BLOCKED_WITHOUT_INTERNET_PERMISSION

Value: 333340911
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 36.

On Android ERROR(/android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES.VANILLA_ICE_CREAM) or higher releases, network access from apps targeting Android 36 or higher that do not have the Manifest.permission.INTERNET permission is considered blocked. This results in API behaviors change for apps without Manifest.permission.INTERNET permission. NetworkInfo returned from ConnectivityManager APIs always has NetworkInfo.DetailedState.BLOCKED. ConnectivityManager.getActiveNetwork() always returns null. ERROR(/android.net.ConnectivityManager.NetworkCallback#onBlockedStatusChanged()) is always called with blocked=true.

For backwards compatibility, apps running on older releases, or targeting older SDK levels, network access from apps without Manifest.permission.INTERNET permission is considered not blocked even though apps cannot access any networks.

NEVER_SANDBOX_DISPLAY_APIS

Value: 184838306

This change id forces the packages it is applied to never have Display API sandboxing applied for a letterbox or SCM activity. The Display APIs will continue to provide DisplayArea bounds.

OVERRIDE_ANY_ORIENTATION

Value: 265464455
Disabled for all apps.

When enabled, allows OVERRIDE_LANDSCAPE_ORIENTATION_TO_REVERSE_LANDSCAPE, OVERRIDE_UNDEFINED_ORIENTATION_TO_NOSENSOR and OVERRIDE_UNDEFINED_ORIENTATION_TO_PORTRAIT to override any orientation requested by the activity.

OVERRIDE_ANY_ORIENTATION_TO_USER

Value: 310816437
Disabled for all apps.

Enables SCREEN_ORIENTATION_USER which overrides any orientation requested by the activity. Fixed orientation apps can be overridden to fullscreen on large screen devices with ignoreOrientationRequest enabled with this override.

OVERRIDE_CAMERA_COMPAT_DISABLE_FORCE_ROTATION

Value: 263959004
Disabled for all apps.

This change id excludes the packages it is applied to from the camera compat force rotation treatment. See com.android.server.wm.DisplayRotationCompatPolicy for context.

OVERRIDE_CAMERA_COMPAT_DISABLE_FREEFORM_WINDOWING_TREATMENT

Value: 314961188
Disabled for all apps.

Excludes the packages the override is applied to from the camera compatibility treatment in free-form windowing mode for fixed-orientation apps.

In free-form windowing mode, the compatibility treatment emulates running on a portrait device by letterboxing the app window and changing the camera characteristics to what apps commonly expect in a portrait device: 90 and 270 degree sensor rotation for back and front cameras, respectively, and setting display rotation to 0.

Use this flag to disable the compatibility treatment for apps that do not respond well to the treatment.

OVERRIDE_CAMERA_COMPAT_DISABLE_REFRESH

Value: 264304459
Disabled for all apps.

This change id excludes the packages it is applied to from activity refresh after camera compat force rotation treatment. See com.android.server.wm.DisplayRotationCompatPolicy for context.

OVERRIDE_CAMERA_COMPAT_ENABLE_REFRESH_VIA_PAUSE

Value: 264301586
Disabled for all apps.

This change id makes the packages it is applied to do activity refresh after camera compat force rotation treatment using "resumed -> paused -> resumed" cycle rather than "resumed -> ... -> stopped -> ... -> resumed" cycle. See com.android.server.wm.DisplayRotationCompatPolicy for context.

OVERRIDE_CAMERA_LANDSCAPE_TO_PORTRAIT

Value: 250678880
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 1.

Force camera output to be rotated to portrait orientation on landscape cameras. Many apps do not handle this situation and display stretched images otherwise.

OVERRIDE_CAMERA_RESIZABLE_AND_SDK_CHECK

Value: 191513214
Disabled for all apps.

When enabled this change id forces the packages it is applied to ignore the current value of 'android:resizeableActivity' as well as target SDK equal to or below M and consider the activity as non-resizeable. In this case, the value of camera rotate & crop will only depend on the needed compensation considering the current display rotation.

OVERRIDE_CAMERA_ROTATE_AND_CROP_DEFAULTS

Value: 189229956
Disabled for all apps.

When enabled this change id forces the packages it is applied to override the default camera rotate & crop behavior and always return CaptureRequest.SCALER_ROTATE_AND_CROP_NONE . The default behavior along with all possible override combinations is discussed in the table below.

OVERRIDE_DISABLE_MEDIA_PROJECTION_SINGLE_APP_OPTION

Value: 316897322
Disabled for all apps.

This change id ensures that users are presented with a choice of capturing a single app or the entire screen when initiating a MediaProjection session, overriding the usage of MediaProjectionConfig#createConfigForDefaultDisplay.

OVERRIDE_ENABLE_COMPAT_FAKE_FOCUS

Value: 263259275
Disabled for all apps.

Enables sending fake focus for unfocused apps in splitscreen. Some game engines wait to get focus before drawing the content of the app so fake focus helps them to avoid staying blacked out when they are resumed and do not have focus yet.

OVERRIDE_ENABLE_COMPAT_IGNORE_ORIENTATION_REQUEST_WHEN_LOOP_DETECTED

Value: 273509367
Disabled for all apps.

This change id enables compat policy that ignores app requested orientation in response to an app calling Activity.setRequestedOrientation(int) more than twice in one second if an activity is not letterboxed for fixed orientation. See com.android.server.wm.LetterboxUiController#shouldIgnoreRequestedOrientation for details.

OVERRIDE_ENABLE_COMPAT_IGNORE_REQUESTED_ORIENTATION

Value: 254631730
Disabled for all apps.

This change id enables compat policy that ignores app requested orientation in response to an app calling Activity.setRequestedOrientation(int). See com.android.server.wm.LetterboxUiController#shouldIgnoreRequestedOrientation for details.

OVERRIDE_ENABLE_INSETS_DECOUPLED_CONFIGURATION

Value: 327313645
Disabled for all apps.

When enabled, the activity will receive configuration decoupled from system bar insets.

This will only apply if the activity is targeting SDK level 34 or earlier versions.

This will only in effect if the device is trying to provide a different value by default other than the legacy value, i.e., the Flags.allowsScreenSizeDecoupledFromStatusBarAndCutout() is set to true.

If the Flags.insetsDecoupledConfiguration() is also set to true, all apps targeting SDK level 35 or later, and apps with this override flag will receive the insets decoupled configuration.

OVERRIDE_LANDSCAPE_ORIENTATION_TO_REVERSE_LANDSCAPE

Value: 266124927
Disabled for all apps.

Enables SCREEN_ORIENTATION_REVERSE_LANDSCAPE. Unless OVERRIDE_ANY_ORIENTATION is enabled, this override is used only when activity specify landscape orientation. This can help apps that assume that landscape display orientation corresponds to Surface.ROTATION_90, while on some devices it can be Surface.ROTATION_270.

OVERRIDE_LAYOUT_IN_DISPLAY_CUTOUT_MODE

Value: 332679525
Disabled for all apps.

Override the layout in display cutout mode behavior. This will only apply if the edge to edge is not enforced.

OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO

Value: 174042980
Disabled for all apps.

This change id is the gatekeeper for all treatments that force a given min aspect ratio. Enabling this change will allow the following min aspect ratio treatments to be applied:

  • OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_SMALL
  • OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_MEDIUM
  • OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_LARGE
If OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO is applied, the min aspect ratio given in the app's manifest will be overridden to the largest enabled aspect ratio treatment unless the app's manifest value is higher. By default, this will only apply to activities with fixed portrait orientation if OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_PORTRAIT_ONLY is not explicitly disabled.

OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_EXCLUDE_PORTRAIT_FULLSCREEN

Value: 218959984
Disabled for all apps.

Overrides the min aspect ratio restriction in portrait fullscreen in order to use all available screen space.

OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_LARGE

Value: 180326787
Disabled for all apps.

This change id sets the activity's min aspect ratio to a large value as defined by OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_LARGE_VALUE. This treatment only takes effect if OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO is also enabled.

OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_MEDIUM

Value: 180326845
Disabled for all apps.

This change id sets the activity's min aspect ratio to a medium value as defined by OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_MEDIUM_VALUE. This treatment only takes effect if OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO is also enabled.

OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_ONLY_FOR_CAMERA

Value: 325586858
Disabled for all apps.

This change id restricts treatments that force a given min aspect ratio to only when an app is connected to the camera

OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_PORTRAIT_ONLY

Value: 203647190
Enabled for all apps.

This change id restricts treatments that force a given min aspect ratio to activities whose orientation is fixed to portrait. This treatment is enabled by default and only takes effect if OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO is also enabled.

OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_SMALL

Value: 349045028
Disabled for all apps.

This change id sets the activity's min aspect ratio to a small value as defined by OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_SMALL_VALUE. This treatment only takes effect if OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO is also enabled.

OVERRIDE_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_TO_ALIGN_WITH_SPLIT_SCREEN

Value: 208648326
Disabled for all apps.

Enables the use of split screen aspect ratio. This allows an app to use all the available space in split mode avoiding letterboxing.

OVERRIDE_ORIENTATION_ONLY_FOR_CAMERA

Value: 265456536
Disabled for all apps.

When enabled, activates OVERRIDE_LANDSCAPE_ORIENTATION_TO_REVERSE_LANDSCAPE, OVERRIDE_UNDEFINED_ORIENTATION_TO_NOSENSOR and OVERRIDE_UNDEFINED_ORIENTATION_TO_PORTRAIT only when an app is connected to the camera. See com.android.server.wm.DisplayRotationCompatPolicy for more context.

OVERRIDE_RESPECT_REQUESTED_ORIENTATION

Value: 236283604
Disabled for all apps.

This change id excludes the packages it is applied to from ignoreOrientationRequest behaviour that can be enabled by the device manufacturers for the com.android.server.wm.DisplayArea or for the whole display.

OVERRIDE_SANDBOX_VIEW_BOUNDS_APIS

Value: 237531167
Disabled for all apps.

This change id forces the packages it is applied to sandbox View API to an activity bounds for:

View.getLocationOnScreen(int), View.getWindowVisibleDisplayFrame(Rect), View#getWindowDisplayFrame, View#getBoundsOnScreen.

For View.getWindowVisibleDisplayFrame(Rect) and View#getWindowDisplayFrame this sandboxing is happening indirectly through android.view.ViewRootImpl#getWindowVisibleDisplayFrame, android.view.ViewRootImpl#getDisplayFrame respectively.

Some applications assume that they occupy the whole screen and therefore use the display coordinates in their calculations as if an activity is positioned in the top-left corner of the screen, with left coordinate equal to 0. This may not be the case of applications in multi-window and in letterbox modes. This can lead to shifted or out of bounds UI elements in case the activity is Letterboxed or is in multi-window mode.

OVERRIDE_UNDEFINED_ORIENTATION_TO_NOSENSOR

Value: 265451093
Disabled for all apps.

Enables SCREEN_ORIENTATION_NOSENSOR. Unless OVERRIDE_ANY_ORIENTATION is enabled, this override is used only when no other fixed orientation was specified by the activity.

OVERRIDE_UNDEFINED_ORIENTATION_TO_PORTRAIT

Value: 265452344
Disabled for all apps.

Enables SCREEN_ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT. Unless OVERRIDE_ANY_ORIENTATION is enabled, this override is used only when no other fixed orientation was specified by the activity.

OVERRIDE_USE_DISPLAY_LANDSCAPE_NATURAL_ORIENTATION

Value: 255940284
Disabled for all apps.

This override fixes display orientation to landscape natural orientation when a task is fullscreen. While display rotation is fixed to landscape, the orientation requested by the activity will be still respected by bounds resolution logic. For instance, if an activity requests portrait orientation and this override is set, then activity will appear in the letterbox mode for fixed orientation with the display rotated to the lanscape natural orientation.

This override is applicable only when natural orientation of the device is landscape and display ignores orientation requestes.

Main use case for this override are camera-using activities that are portrait-only and assume alignment with natural device orientation. Such activities can automatically be rotated with com.android.server.wm.DisplayRotationCompatPolicy but not all of them can handle dynamic rotation and thus can benefit from this override.

PARSE_CONTENT_DISPOSITION_USING_RFC_6266

Value: 319400769
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

This feature enables parsing of Content-Disposition headers that conform to RFC 6266. In particular, this enables parsing of filename* values which can use a different character encoding.

PENDING_INTENT_EXPLICIT_MUTABILITY_REQUIRED

Value: 160794467

PHONE_STATE_LISTENER_LIMIT_CHANGE_ID

Value: 150880553
Enabled for all apps.

This change enables a limit on the number of TelephonyCallback objects any process may register via TelephonyManager.registerTelephonyCallback(int, Executor, TelephonyCallback). The default limit is 50, which may change via remote device config updates. This limit is enforced via an IllegalStateException thrown from TelephonyManager.registerTelephonyCallback(int, Executor, TelephonyCallback) when the offending process attempts to register one too many callbacks.

PREVENT_META_REFLECTION_BLOCKLIST_ACCESS

Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Remove meta-reflection workaround for hidden api usage for apps targeting R+. This allowed apps to obtain references to blocklist fields and methods through an extra layer of reflection.

PREVENT_SETTING_PASSWORD_QUALITY_ON_PARENT

Value: 165573442
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

Admin apps targeting Android S+ may not use DevicePolicyManager.setPasswordQuality(ComponentName, int) to set password quality on the DevicePolicyManager instance obtained by calling DevicePolicyManager.getParentProfileInstance(ComponentName). Instead, they should use DevicePolicyManager.setRequiredPasswordComplexity(int) to set coarse-grained password requirements device-wide.

PRE_APPROVAL_WITH_UPDATE_OWNERSHIP_FIX

Value: 293644536
Disabled for all apps.

The system supports pre-approval and update ownership features from ERROR(API 34/Build.VERSION_CODES#UPSIDE_DOWN_CAKE API 34). The change id is used to make sure the system includes the fix of pre-approval with update ownership case. When checking the change id, if it is disabled, it means the build includes the fix. The more detail is on b/293644536. See ERROR(/PackageInstaller.SessionParams#setRequestUpdateOwnership(boolean)) and ERROR(/#requestUserPreapproval(PreapprovalDetails, IntentSender)) for more details.

Since Android 14, offer(E) requires all elements to be comparable if there was no comparator. Previously, the first element being added did not need to be comparable. This flag is enabled for apps targeting Android 14+.

PROCESS_CAPABILITY_CHANGE_ID

Value: 136274596
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Flag Context.BIND_INCLUDE_CAPABILITIES is used to pass while-in-use capabilities from client process to bound service. In targetSdkVersion R and above, if client is a TOP activity, when this flag is present, bound service gets all while-in-use capabilities; when this flag is not present, bound service gets no while-in-use capability from client.

RATE_LIMIT_TOASTS

Value: 174840628
Used for logging only.

Rate limit showing toasts, on a per package basis. It limits the number of ERROR(/Toast#show()) calls to prevent overburdening the user with too many toasts in a limited time. Any attempt to show more toasts than allowed in a certain time frame will result in the toast being discarded.

Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Require the hosting job to specify a network constraint if the included JobWorkItem indicates network usage.

REQUIRE_NETWORK_PERMISSIONS_FOR_CONNECTIVITY_JOBS

Value: 271850009
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Require the app to have the ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE permissions when scheduling a job with a connectivity constraint.

REQUIRE_READ_PHONE_STATE_PERMISSION_FOR_ACTIVE_DATA_SUB_ID

Value: 182478738
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

To check the SDK version for TelephonyCallback.ActiveDataSubscriptionIdListener should add Manifest.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE since Android 12.

REQUIRE_READ_PHONE_STATE_PERMISSION_FOR_CELL_INFO

Value: 184323934
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

To check the SDK version for TelephonyCallback.CellInfoListener should add Manifest.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE since Android 12.

REQUIRE_READ_PHONE_STATE_PERMISSION_FOR_DISPLAY_INFO

Value: 183164979
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

To check the SDK version for TelephonyCallback.DisplayInfoListener should remove Manifest.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE since Android 12.

REQUIRE_TURN_SCREEN_ON_PERMISSION

Value: 216114297
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 10000.

Apps targeting Android V and above need to define Manifest.permission.TURN_SCREEN_ON in their manifest for PowerManager.ACQUIRE_CAUSES_WAKEUP to have any effect. Note that most applications should use R.attr.turnScreenOn or Activity.setTurnScreenOn(boolean) instead, as this prevents the previous foreground app from being resumed first when the screen turns on.

RESOURCES_ARSC_COMPRESSED

Value: 132742131
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

The resources.arsc of one of the APKs being installed is compressed or not aligned on a 4-byte boundary. Resource tables that cannot be memory mapped exert excess memory pressure on the system and drastically slow down construction of Resources objects.

RESTRICT_ADB_BACKUP

Value: 171032338
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

When this change is enabled, adb backup is automatically turned on for apps running as debuggable (android:debuggable set to true) and unavailable to any other apps.

RESTRICT_AUDIO_ATTRIBUTES

Value: 331793339
Used for logging only.

Corrects audio attributes for notifications based on characteristics of the notifications.

RESTRICT_DOMAINS

Value: 175408749
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

With the updated form of the app links verification APIs, an app will be required to declare domains inside an intent filter which includes all of the following:

  • - android:autoVerify="true"
  • - Intent.ACTION_VIEW
  • - Intent.CATEGORY_BROWSABLE
  • - Intent.CATEGORY_DEFAULT
  • - Only IntentFilter.SCHEME_HTTP and/or IntentFilter.SCHEME_HTTPS, with no other schemes

On prior versions of Android, Intent.CATEGORY_BROWSABLE was not a requirement, other schemes were allowed, and setting autoVerify to true in any intent filter would implicitly pretend that all intent filters were set to autoVerify="true".

RESTRICT_ENABLE_DISABLE

Value: 218493289
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

Starting with Build.VERSION_CODES.TIRAMISU, applications are not allowed to enable/disable Bluetooth.

RESTRICT_STORAGE_ACCESS_FRAMEWORK

Value: 141600225
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

We support restrict Storage Access Framework from Build.VERSION_CODES.R. App Compatibility flag that indicates whether the app should be restricted or not. This flag is turned on by default for all apps targeting > Build.VERSION_CODES.Q.

RETURN_ADVANCED_VIDEO_PROFILES

Value: 206033068
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

This change id controls the kind of video profiles returned by getAll(String, int).

RETURN_DEFAULT_ON_SECURITY_EXCEPTION

Value: 239784307
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

Trying to read the wallpaper file or bitmap in T will return the default wallpaper bitmap/file instead of throwing a SecurityException.

RETURN_DEVICE_VOLUME_BEHAVIOR_ABSOLUTE_ADJUST_ONLY

Value: 240663182
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Controls whether DEVICE_VOLUME_BEHAVIOR_ABSOLUTE_ADJUST_ONLY may be returned by getDeviceVolumeBehavior. If this is disabled, DEVICE_VOLUME_BEHAVIOR_FULL is returned in its place.

RETURN_NULL_HARDWARE_ADDRESS

Value: 170188668
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

If this change is enabled, getHardwareAddress() returns null when the hardware address is inaccessible. If the change is disabled, the default MAC address (02:00:00:00:00:00) is returned instead.

RETURN_REGISTRATION_STATE_EMERGENCY

Value: 255938466
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

A new registration state, REGISTRATION_STATE_EMERGENCY, is added to NetworkRegistrationInfo. This change will affect the result of getRegistration().

ROLE_MANAGER_USER_HANDLE_AWARE

Value: 303742236
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

For apps targeting Android V and above, several methods are now user-handle-aware, which means they use the user contained within the context. For apps targeting an SDK version below this, the user of the calling process will be used.

RUN_NATIVE_NSD_ONLY_IF_LEGACY_APPS_T_AND_LATER

Value: 235355681
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

When enabled, apps targeting < Android 12 are considered legacy for the NSD native daemon. The platform will only keep the daemon running as long as there are any legacy apps connected. After Android 12, direct communication with the native daemon might not work since the native daemon won't always stay alive. Using the NSD APIs from NsdManager as the replacement is recommended. Another alternative could be bundling your own mdns solutions instead of depending on the system mdns native daemon. This compatibility change applies to Android 13 and later only. To toggle behavior on Android 12 and Android 12L, use RUN_NATIVE_NSD_ONLY_IF_LEGACY_APPS.

SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM_DENIED_BY_DEFAULT

Value: 226439802
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

The permission Manifest.permission.SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM will be denied, unless the user explicitly allows it from Settings.

SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM_DOES_NOT_ELEVATE_BUCKET

Value: 262645982
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Holding the permission Manifest.permission.SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM will no longer pin the standby-bucket of the app to UsageStatsManager.STANDBY_BUCKET_WORKING_SET or better.

SECURITY_EXCEPTION_ON_INVALID_ATTRIBUTION_TAG_CHANGE

Value: 151105954
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

Enforce that all attributionTags send to noteOp(String, int, String), noteProxyOp(String, String), and startOp(String, int, String) are defined in the manifest of the package that is specified as parameter to the methods.

To enable this change both the package calling noteOp(String, int, String) as well as the package specified as parameter to the method need to have this change enable.

SELF_TARGETING_OVERLAY

Value: 205919743
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Applications can use OverlayManager to create overlays to overlay on itself resources. The overlay target is itself and the work range is only in caller application.

In Context.getSystemService(String), it crashes because of NullPointerException if the parameter is OverlayManager. if the self-targeting is enabled, the caller application can get the OverlayManager instance to use self-targeting functionality.

SELINUX_LATEST_CHANGES

Value: 143539591
Disabled for all apps.

Allows opt-in to the latest targetSdkVersion enforced changes without changing target SDK. Turning this change on for an app targeting the latest SDK or higher is a no-op.

Has no effect for apps using shared user id. TODO(b/143539591): Update description with relevant SELINUX changes this opts in to.

SELINUX_R_CHANGES

Value: 168782947
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

This change gates apps access to untrusted_app_R-targetSDK SELinux domain. Allows opt-in to R targetSdkVersion enforced changes without changing target SDK. Turning this change off for an app targeting >= android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES.R is a no-op.

Has no effect for apps using shared user id. TODO(b/143539591): Update description with relevant SELINUX changes this opts in to.

SEND_ACTIVATION_AZR_STATUSES

Value: 308673617
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Send new activation AutomaticZenRule statuses to apps with a min target SDK version

SEND_CHOOSER_RESULT

Value: 263474465
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Controls whether to send ChooserResult to the optional IntentSender supplied to the Chooser.

When enabled, ChooserResult is added to the provided Intent as Intent.EXTRA_CHOOSER_RESULT, and sent for actions such as copy and edit, in addition to activity selection. When disabled, only the selected component is provided in Intent.EXTRA_CHOSEN_COMPONENT.

See: Intent.createChooser(Intent, CharSequence, IntentSender)

SEND_ON_FAILURE_FOR_ASYNC_EXCEPTIONS

Value: 280471513
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Gates returning ERROR(/Callback#onFailure) and ERROR(/Callback#onUnknownFailure) when asynchronous exceptions are propagated to the client. If the change is not enabled, the existing behavior of delivering ERROR(/#STATE_ERROR) is retained.

SETTINGS_API_V2

Value: 178111421
Enabled for all apps.

The new user preference API for verifying domains marked autoVerify=true in AndroidManifest.xml intent filters is not yet implemented in the current platform preview. This is anticipated to ship before S releases. For now, it is possible to preview the new user preference changes by enabling this ChangeId and using the adb shell pm set-app-links-user-selection and similar commands.

SET_LISTENER_ACCESS_GRANTED_IS_USER_AWARE

Value: 302563478
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

For apps targeting Build.VERSION_CODES.VANILLA_ICE_CREAM and above, the setNotificationListenerAccessGranted method will use the user contained within the context. For apps targeting an SDK version below this, the user of the calling process will be used (Process.myUserHandle()).

SHOULD_RESOLVE_PORT_INDEX_FOR_APPS

Value: 224562872
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

With support for MEP(multiple enabled profile) in Android T, a SIM card can enable multiple profile on different port. If apps are not target SDK T yet and keep calling the switchToSubscription or download API without specifying the port index, we should keep the existing behaviour by always use port index 0 even the device itself has MEP eUICC, this is for carrier app's backward compatibility.

SILENT_INSTALL_ALLOWED

Value: 325888262
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

If an app being installed targets ERROR(API 33/Build.VERSION_CODES#TIRAMISU API 33) and above, the app can be installed without user action. See ERROR(/PackageInstaller.SessionParams#setRequireUserAction) for other conditions required to be satisfied for a silent install.

SKIP_MULTIPLE_MISSED_PERIODIC_TASKS

Value: 351566728
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 36.

For fixed rate tasks, prevent multiple tasks from running back-to-back to account for missed periods. On Android, it's often the case that app processes will miss multiple scheduled periods because the CPU often enters suspended states, or because app processes may be moved to the Cached Apps Freezer. This flag prevents apps from thrashing upon exiting suspend or frozen states to needlessly "catch up" to lost time.

SPLIT_AS_STREAM_RETURNS_SINGLE_EMPTY_STRING

Value: 288845345
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Since Android 14, splitAsStream(CharSequence) return a stream of a single empty String as described in the API documentation. Previously, given an empty string input, the method returns an empty stream. This flag is enabled for apps targeting Android 14+.

START_ACTIVITY_NEEDS_PENDING_INTENT

Value: 241766793
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

The method startActivityAndCollapse(Intent) will verify that only apps targeting Build.VERSION_CODES.UPSIDE_DOWN_CAKE or higher will not be allowed to use it.

STATICLAYOUT_FALLBACK_LINESPACING

Value: 37756858
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 28.

This change ID enables the fallback text line spacing (line height) for StaticLayout.

STPE_SKIP_MULTIPLE_MISSED_PERIODIC_TASKS

Value: 288912692
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 36.

For fixed rate tasks, prevent multiple tasks from running back-to-back to account for missed periods. On Android, it's often the case that app processes will miss multiple scheduled periods because the CPU often enters suspended states, or because app processes may be moved to the Cached Apps Freezer. This flag prevents apps from thrashing upon exiting suspend or frozen states to needlessly "catch up" to lost time.

STREAM_INT_DIFFERS_FROM_NEXT_INT

Value: 308103782
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

After https://bugs.openjdk.org/browse/JDK-8301574 ints() and long() methods generate different sequence of number than nextInt() and nextLong() calls would.

SUPPORT_DEREGISTERING_LOSING_PDN_STATE

Value: 201522903
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 32.

For apps targeting Android T and above, support the DEREGISTERING_REASON_LOSING_PDN state on APIs, such as DelegateRegistrationState#addDeregisteringFeatureTag and DelegateRegistrationState#getDeregisteringFeatureTags

SUPPORT_PUBLISHING_STATE

Value: 202894742
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 32.

For apps targeting Android T and above, support the publishing state on APIs, such as RcsUceAdapter#PUBLISH_STATE_PUBLISHING

SUPPORT_REGISTERING_DELEGATE_STATE

Value: 205194548
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 32.

For apps targeting Android T and above, support the REGISTERING state on APIs, such as DelegateRegistrationState#addRegisteringFeatureTags and DelegateRegistrationState#getRegisteringFeatureTags

SWITCH_WITHOUT_PORT_INDEX_EXCEPTION_ON_DISABLE

Value: 218393363
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

Apps targeting on Android T and beyond will get exception whenever switchToSubscription without portIndex is called for disable subscription.

THROW_EXCEPTION_COMMIT_WITH_IMMUTABLE_PENDING_INTENT

Value: 240618202
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Throws IllegalArgumentException if the ERROR(/IntentSender) from an immutable PendingIntent when caller has a target SDK of API Build.VERSION_CODES.VANILLA_ICE_CREAM or above.

THROW_EXCEPTION_ON_REQUIRE_INSTALL_PACKAGES_TO_ADD_INSTALLER_PACKAGE

Value: 150857253
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Adding an installer package name to a package that does not have one set requires the INSTALL_PACKAGES permission. If the caller targets R, this will throw a SecurityException. Otherwise the request will fail silently. In both cases, and regardless of whether this change is enabled, the installer package will remain unchanged.

THROW_EXCEPTION_WHEN_KEY_MISSING

Value: 175101461
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

For Admin Apps targeting U+ If ERROR(/android.security.IKeyChainService#setGrant) is called with an alias with no existing key, throw IllegalArgumentException.

THROW_FOR_ACTIVITY_MEDIA_BUTTON_RECEIVER

Value: 272737196
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

MediaSession.setMediaButtonReceiver(android.app.PendingIntent) throws an IllegalArgumentException if the provided PendingIntent targets an activity for apps targeting Android V and above. For apps targeting Android U and below, the request will be ignored.

THROW_FOR_INVALID_BROADCAST_RECEIVER

Value: 270049379
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

MediaSession.setMediaButtonBroadcastReceiver(android.content.ComponentName) throws an IllegalArgumentException if the provided ComponentName does not resolve to a valid broadcast receiver for apps targeting Android U and above. For apps targeting Android T and below, the request will be ignored.

THROW_ON_INITIALIZE_IF_NO_DSP

Value: 269165460
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Gates returning IllegalStateException in ERROR(/#initialize( PersistableBundle, SharedMemory, SoundTrigger.ModuleProperties)) when no DSP module is available. If the change is not enabled, the existing behavior of not throwing an exception and delivering ERROR(/STATE_HARDWARE_UNAVAILABLE) is retained.

THROW_ON_INVALID_DATA_TRANSFER_IMPLEMENTATION

Value: 255371817
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

Whether to throw an exception when an app doesn't properly implement all the necessary data transfer APIs.

THROW_ON_INVALID_PRIORITY_VALUE

Value: 140852299
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 33.

Whether to throw an exception when an app provides an invalid priority value via JobInfo.Builder.setPriority(int). Legacy apps may be incorrectly using the API and so the call will silently fail for them if they continue using the API.

THROW_ON_SECURITY_EXCEPTION

Value: 237508058
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

In U and later, attempting to read the wallpaper file or bitmap will throw an exception, (except with the READ_WALLPAPER_INTERNAL permission).

THROW_ON_UNSUPPORTED_BIAS_USAGE

Value: 300477393
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Throw an exception when biases are set by an unsupported client.

THROW_SECURITY_EXCEPTIONS

Value: 147340954
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Pre R a SecurityException would only be thrown by setEnabled APIs (e .g. #setEnabled(String, boolean, UserHandle)) for a permission error. Since R this no longer holds true, and SecurityException can be thrown for any number of reasons, none of which are exposed to the caller.

To maintain existing API behavior, if a legacy permission failure or actor enforcement failure occurs for an app not yet targeting R, coerce it into an IllegalStateException, which existed in the source prior to R.

THROW_SECURITY_EXCEPTION_FOR_SENSOR_PERMISSIONS

Value: 277035314
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Apps targeting V+ should now expect that attempts to grant sensor permissions without authorisation will result in a security exception.

USE_ASYNC_SHOW_HIDE_METHOD

Value: 352594277
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Use async method for showSoftInput(View, int, ResultReceiver), showSoftInput(View, int) and hideSoftInputFromWindow(IBinder, int, ResultReceiver), hideSoftInputFromWindow(IBinder, int) for apps targeting V+.

Apps can incorrectly rely on showSoftInput(View, int) and hideSoftInputFromWindow(IBinder, int) method return type to interpret result of a request rather than relying on ResultReceiver. The return type of the method was never documented to have accurate info of visibility but few apps incorrectly rely on it.

Starting Android V, we use async calls into system_server which returns true if method call was made but return type doesn't guarantee execution. Apps targeting older versions will fallback to existing behavior of calling synchronous methods which had undocumented result in return type.

USE_BOUNDS_FOR_WIDTH

Value: 63938206
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

This change ID enables the bounding box based layout.

USE_EXPERIMENTAL_COMPONENT_ALIAS

Value: 196254758
Disabled for all apps.

This flag has to be enabled for the "android" package to use component aliases.

USE_NEW_BFSL_LOGIC

Value: 311208749
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Compat ID to enable the new FGS start logic, for deciding whether to allow FGS start from the background.

USE_NEW_ISO_LOCALE_CODES

Value: 291868760
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

On Android V+ when this flag is enabled language codes are no longer converted to their obsolete forms: iw maps to he, ji maps to yi, and in maps to id.

USE_NEW_WIU_LOGIC_FOR_CAPABILITIES

Value: 313677553
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Compat ID to enable the new FGS start logic, for capability calculation.

USE_NEW_WIU_LOGIC_FOR_START

Value: 311208629
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

Compat ID to enable the new FGS start logic, for permission calculation used for per-FGS-type eligibility calculation. (See also android.app.ForegroundServiceTypePolicy)

USE_REAL_ROOT_LOCALE

Value: 159047832
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Since Android 11, formatter classes, e.g. java.text.SimpleDateFormat, no longer provide English data when Locale.ROOT format is requested. Please use Locale.ENGLISH to format in English. Note that Locale.ROOT is used as language/country neutral locale or fallback locale, and does not guarantee to represent English locale. This flag is only for documentation and can't be overridden by app. Please use targetSdkVersion to enable the new behavior.

USE_SET_COMMUNICATION_DEVICE

Value: 243827847
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 32.

Indicates that default communication device is chosen by routing rules in audio policy manager and not forced by AudioDeviceBroker.

USE_SET_LOCATION_ENABLED

Value: 117835097
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 30.

Admin apps targeting Android R+ may not use DevicePolicyManager.setSecureSetting(ComponentName, String, String) to change the deprecated Settings.Secure.LOCATION_MODE setting. Instead they should use DevicePolicyManager.setLocationEnabled(ComponentName, boolean).

USE_SHORT_FGS_USAGE_INTERACTION_TIME

Value: 183972877
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 31.

For apps targeting S+, this determines whether to use a shorter timeout before elevating the standby bucket to ACTIVE when apps start a foreground service.

USE_STRETCH_EDGE_EFFECT_BY_DEFAULT

Value: 171228096
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 1.

This sets the edge effect to use stretch instead of glow.

VALIDATE_ZIP_PATH_FOR_PATH_TRAVERSAL

Value: 242716250
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 34.

This change targets zip path traversal vulnerabilities by throwing ZipException if zip path entries contain ".." or start with "/".

The exception will be thrown in ZipInputStream.getNextEntry() or ZipFile.ZipFile(String).

This validation is enabled for apps with targetSDK >= U.

WEARABLE_EXTENDER_BACKGROUND_BLOCKED

Value: 270551184
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 35.

The call to WearableExtender#setBackground(Bitmap) will have no effect and the passed Bitmap will not be retained in memory.

WEAROS_WALLPAPER_HANDLES_SCALING

Value: 272527315
Enabled for apps with a targetSdkVersion of greater than or equal to 36.

Wear products currently force a slight scaling transition to wallpapers when the QSS is opened. However, on Wear 6 (SDK 35) and above, 1P watch faces will be expected to either implement their own scaling, or to override this method to allow the WallpaperController to continue to scale for them.
